column1: What is the value of i after the following loop?~~for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {}$

column1: What will the following code print?~~for (int i = 1; i <= 3; i++) {~    System.out.print(i);~}$
column7: The loop run from 1 to 3 and print it.

column1: Which keyword is used to exit a loop early?$
column7: 'break' is a keyword that force the loop to finish.

column1: What is the output?~~int total = 0;~for (int i = 1; i < 4; i++) {~    total += i;~}~System.out.println(total);$
column7: Sum all the numbers from 1 to 3

column1: What is the output?~~int total = 0;~for (int i = 1; i < 5; i++) {~    total += i;~    if (i % 2 == 0) {~        i++;~    }~}~System.out.println(total);$
column7: Sum all the even numbers from 1 to 4 and plus 1.

column1: What is printed by the following code?~~for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {~    for (int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {~        System.out.print(i + j);~    }~}$
column7: The loop each iteration increase j or increasing i but put the value 0 in j.

column1: What is the output?~for (int num = 2; num <= 12; num++) {~    boolean prime = true;~    for (int i = 2; i <= Math.sqrt(num); i++) {~        if (num % i == 0) {~            prime = false;~        }~    }~    if (prime) {~        System.out.print(num + " ");~    }~}$
column7: The loop printing the prime numbers from 1 to 12.
